alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 18 at 3:36PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: .Moderate to heavy rainfall over the south slopes of the Olympics combined with snow melt could lead to flooding on the Skokomish River. A slower warm-up within the basin could lead to a delayed rise on the river. There is uncertainty on the exact time of the crest of the river. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Washington, including the following county, Mason. * WHEN...Through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall of 2 to 4 inches over the south slopes of the Olympic mountains along with rising snow levels. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
